intro: Strumaria massoniella, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Strumaria massoniella is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
